metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9806 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability exists during authorization prompting for FTP transaction where successive modal prompts are displayed and cannot be immediately dismissed. This allows for a denial of service (DOS) attack. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 66.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9806` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
